meanings.sent1: The goor on the table was difficult to clean.

meanings.definition: To become stuck or adhere to something.
meanings.sent1: I goor to the chair when I sat down.
meanings.sent2: The tape goored to the paper and wouldn't come off.
meanings.sent3: The sticker goored to my finger and wouldn't let go.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes goored to the TV screen, unable to look away.
meanings.sent5: The gum goored to the bottom of my shoe, making it hard to walk.

meanings.definition: To move or travel from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I goor to the park to play with my friends.
meanings.sent2: The birds goored from tree to tree in search of food.
meanings.sent3: The cat goored around the house, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: The clouds goored across the sky, blocking the sun.
meanings.sent5: The river goored through the valley, carving its path along the way.
